title: Notifications dropdown panel background colors for light/dark mode

requirements.summary: Set the Notifications dropdown panel surface background to #ffffff in light mode and #1a1a1a in dark mode without affecting the trigger button or other dropdowns.
acceptanceCriteria: When the app theme is dark, the Notifications dropdown panel surface (DropdownMenuContent and its internal panel areas) renders with background #1a1a1a.
When the app theme is light, the Notifications dropdown panel surface renders with background #ffffff.
No other dropdown menus/components have their background colors changed as part of this update.
There are no hardcoded inline backgroundColor styles left that force #1a1a1a in light mode inside the notifications dropdown.

file_operations.description: Remove inline backgroundColor styles that currently force a dark background, and apply local Tailwind classes to only the notifications dropdown surface: set DropdownMenuContent to use bg-[#ffffff] in light mode and dark:bg-[#1a1a1a] in dark mode. Ensure internal wrapper sections (header, empty states, ScrollArea container, list wrapper) inherit or explicitly use the same light/dark background classes so the entire panel surface matches, while keeping the bell trigger button styling unchanged and not modifying any other dropdown implementations.
